[Topic Module]

Detailed Description

This module defines support for IDL type codes, a part of the CORBA specification which describes a mechanism to represent IDL types at runtime. RTI Data Distribution Service can use type codes to send information about types on the wire.

Type codes are values that are used to describe arbitrarily complex IDL types at runtime. Type code values are manipulated via the DDS_TypeCode interface, which is derived from a CORBA-specified API. Conceptually, a type code value consists of a type code kind (represented by the DDS_TCKind enumeration) and a parameter list. Note that for compound types like structs and arrays, the parameter list will recursively include one or more type code values.

There are a number of uses for type codes. The type code mechanism can be used to unambiguously match type representations. The DDS_TypeCode::equal method is a more reliable test than comparing the string type names, requiring equivalent IDL definitions of the types. In addition to being used locally, RTI Data Distribution Service 4.1 adds support for transmitting a serialized version on the wire between participants. Type codes can be used to access information about types at runtime, for example to be able to publish or subscribe to topics of arbitrarily types. This functionality is useful for a generic system monitoring tool like NDDSSpy.

Type codes are enabled by default when running Nddsgen; the serialized version of a typecode will be published during discovery. The -notypecode option to Nddsgen can be used to disable generation of typecode information. An extended field for the type code information has been added to the builtin types for publications and subscriptions. To support especially complex type codes, it may be necessary to increase the value of the DomainParticipant's DDS_DomainParticipantResourceLimitsQosPolicy::type_code_max_serialized_length.

Accessing TypeCode information:

Locally, a TypeCode may be accessed by calling the Foo_get_typecode function, which returns a DDS_TypeCode pointer. in the code for the type generated by Nddsgen (unless type code support is disabled). On the wire, this information is transmitted during discovery over the publication and subscription builtin topics. They can be accessed using the builtin readers for these topics. The TypeCode values are not cached by RTI Data Distribution Service upon reciept and are therefore not available from the built-in data returned by DDSDataWriter::get_matched_subscription_data or DDSDataReader::get_matched_publication_data.

Creating Type Codes at run-time (Dynamic Type Code API):

The Type Code API includes support for dynamic generation of TypeCode values. Type codes for simple types such as short or char can be accessed through the use of built-in constants such as DDS_g_tc_short and DDS_g_tc_char. Compound type codes are generated using the DDS_TypeCodeFactory interface.

See also:
rtiddsgen, DDS_SubscriptionBuiltinTopicData, DDS_PublicationBuiltinTopicData

Define Documentation

#define DDS_VM_NONE
 

Constant used to indicate that an IDL value type has no modifiers.

Examples:
HelloWorld.cxx.

#define DDS_VM_CUSTOM
 

Constant used to indicate that an IDL value type has the custom modifier.

This modifier is used to specify whether the value type uses custom marshaling.

#define DDS_VM_ABSTRACT
 

Constant used to indicate that an IDL value type has the abstract modifier.

An abstract value type may not be instantiated.

#define DDS_VM_TRUNCATABLE
 

Constant used to indicate that an IDL value type has the truncatable modifier.

A value with a state that derives from another value with a state can be declared as truncatable. A truncatable type means the object can be truncated to the base type.

#define DDS_PRIVATE_MEMBER
 

Constant used to indicate that a value type member is private.

Examples:
HelloWorld.cxx.

#define DDS_PUBLIC_MEMBER
 

Constant used to indicate that a value type member is public.

typedef short DDS_ValueModifier
 

Modifier type for an IDL value type.

typedef short DDS_Visibility
 

Type to indicate the visibility of a value type member.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum DDS_TCKind
 

Enumeration type for typecode kinds.

Type code kinds are modeled as values of this type.

Enumeration values:
DDS_TK_NULL  Indicates that a type code does not describe anything.
DDS_TK_SHORT  IDL short type.
DDS_TK_LONG  IDL long type.
DDS_TK_USHORT  IDL unsigned short type.
DDS_TK_ULONG  IDL unsigned long type.
DDS_TK_FLOAT  IDL float type.
DDS_TK_DOUBLE  IDL double type.
DDS_TK_BOOLEAN  IDL boolean type.
DDS_TK_CHAR  IDL char type.
DDS_TK_OCTET  IDL octet type.
DDS_TK_STRUCT  IDL struct type.
DDS_TK_UNION  IDL union type.
DDS_TK_ENUM  IDL enumerated type.
DDS_TK_STRING  IDL string type.
DDS_TK_SEQUENCE  IDL sequence type.
DDS_TK_ARRAY  IDL array type.
DDS_TK_ALIAS  IDL alias (typedef) type.
DDS_TK_LONGLONG  IDL long long type.
DDS_TK_ULONGLONG  IDL unsigned long long type.
DDS_TK_LONGDOUBLE  IDL long double type.
DDS_TK_WCHAR  IDL wide char type.
DDS_TK_WSTRING  IDL wide string type.
DDS_TK_VALUE  IDL value type.
